description:
area occupied in the seating plane of the geometrical object defined due to installation, protection, operation, service and maintenance reasons.
- The gross area encloses completely the net area of the geometrical object. |
 - The gross area is defined as a plane normally not possible to be occupied by other geometrical objects. |
 - The gross area lies in the seating plane defined by the x/y- axes of the object and can be mathematically derived from the gross space.
